content: What is the process for requesting new coding systems to be added to the IG publisher referenced terminology server? We have some standard coding systems, namely WHO's ICD-O-3, that would greatly benefit HL7 Cancer Interoperability CIC-sponsored Breast Cancer Modeling project. Thanks!

I assume that @Grahame Grieve can best answer that, as at least potentially it's somewhat independent of the core FHIR build. Regarding ICD-O I think it probably makes sense to handle it separately from ICD-9 and ICD-10 which are in the build and documented in the Using ICD-[X] Codes with FHIR page. I don't see an existing tracker for ICD-O, so if you want to submit one to add it to the external code systems and add documentation for it, that would be great.

Thanks @Rob Hausam . I'll review the link and see about filing a tracker for this. ICD-O breaks down to topography and morphology codes. The topography codes do have an overlap in codes with ICD-10 for many cancer types but I suppose it could still be considered separate given its specific use for oncology and additional pairing with the morphology codes to make cancer diagnosis meaningful.
where could I get ICD-O from? can you make a CodeSystem resource for it? @May Terry
@Grahame Grieve - I haven't created one before, but I'll figure it out and update it here when I have it.
@May Terry If you have questions or need anything, just ask.

Hi @Rob Hausam - I was hoping to get just a bit more guidance on Grahame's request for "making a CodeSystem resource" for it and taking into account your suggestion to have this separate from ICD-[X]. What would the artifact be? Would it to be to create an example of the FHIR request and response which includes the URL and/or OID for the ICD-O codes and other supporting metadata, or something else in the form of a template? Also happy to take this offline on a side private thread or a call. Thanks!

Sorry for the delayed reply, May. I was offline for a bit yesterday. We can have some further offline chat and/or discussion on the Terminology stream to further sort this out and figure out the best approach.
